com.googlecode.transmuter.converter
Class Binding

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.transmuter.converter.Binding
Direct Known Subclasses:
Converter
public class Binding
extends Object

Represents an immutable invokable object, made binding a method to an object (which may be null if the method is static).

Not all objects, methods or combinations thereof may be bound. The constructor will try to make sure that the given arguments are mutually compatible, throwing an exception if they are deemed otherwise. The default validation attempts to ensure that invoke calls will not fail due to a method or object invalidity/incompatibility, i.e. that one cannot build an inherently uninvokable Binding.

Author:
Humberto S. N. dos Anjos

Method Detail

initialize

protected void initialize(Object instance,
                          Method method)
                   throws ObjectInstantiationException
Called only in the constructors, this method attempts to validate the given arguments and populate this instance's fields, throwing an exception if the arguments are not deemed valid.

Delegates to tryInitialize for the actual legwork, so subclasses which wish to alter the initialization sequence should override it instead of this method.

This method simply checks tryInitialize's final report to determine if an exception must be thrown. The exception will hold all the problems found with the given arguments.

Parameters:
instance - an object.
method - a method object.
Throws:
ObjectInstantiationException - if any problems were found during initialization.
See Also:
tryInitialize(Object, Method)

tryInitialize

protected Notification tryInitialize(Object instance,
                                     Method method)
Validates the given arguments, and populates this binding's fields accordingly. This method is protected so that subclasses can override it with their own initialization sequence.

This method returns a Notification object, which accumulates any problems verified here and reports the final status of the initialization. The following conditions are checked here:

  • method may not be null. This violation signals a single IllegalArgumentException.
  • method must have public visibility (signals an InaccessibleMethodException).
  • method must be static if instance is null (signals a NullInstanceWithNonStaticMethodException).
  • method must be invokable on instance (signals a MethodInstanceIncompatibilityException).

Parameters:
instance - an object.
method - a method object.
Returns:
a Notification with all errors found during validation e initialization. Cannot be null.

getInstanceClass

public Class<?> getInstanceClass()
Returns the most specific instance class compatible with this binding's instance and method object. That would be the instance's class, if the instance is not null, or the method's declaring class otherwise.

Returns:
the most specific instance class compatible with this binding's instance and method object.

getInstance

public Object getInstance()
Returns this binding's underlying instance. It may be null if this binding represents a static method.

this binding's underlying instance.
